intro: Cnidium monnieri var. monnieri, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and has aromatic, pungent leaves. Its rhizomes and roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant's botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of its family.
